intro: Moltkia anatolica, commonly known as Anatolian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Turkey and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It is adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in its native range. Moltkia anatolica is also noted for its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus.
